alert.note: Alert for Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 7:50AM CDT until May 26 at 8:34AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas... Cottonwood River near Florence affecting Marion County. Cottonwood River near Plymouth affecting Lyon and Chase Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls affecting Chase County. For the Cottonwood River...including Florence, Cottonwood Falls, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River near Florence. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Outside the levee system in southeast Florence, flood waters flow across Park Ave Road and reach the foundation of a residential home. Northwest of Florence, the bridge on 140th Road and 1/2 mile west of Highway 77 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 24.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Cottonwood River Florence 22.0 3.4 Tue 7 am CDT 24.6 14.7 5.3 &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
